intro: Schizoloma retusum, commonly known as the roughleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Schizoloma retusum belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
